discourse_list.title: CES Sprint Update #1 (2022/Q1 - Jan 31st to Feb 11th 2022)

content.content: As defined in the Collateral Management Lifecycle (CML) post, the life cycle implies two big focus areas for CES: Collateral Onboarding and Collateral Maintenance. Within these areas we categorize our output into a set of deliverables(COD1-3, CMD1, CMO1). From now on, CES will provide a bi-monthly update synced with the end of each sprint (2 weeks work cycle).  roadmap-2022-02-164384×1640 366 KB  Roadmap: collapse version - only milestones  Collateral Onboarding  COD1 - COB Process  roadmap-2022-02-164384×840 174 KB   EPIC: Collateral Onboarding Process Revamp   Collateral Onboarding Process document drafted and shared with stakeholders for assessment. Currently in RFC. Started defining metrics for which a benchmark for good collateral candidates for onboarding can be created.  Collateral Status Index forum post, spreadsheet updates and ownership has been transferred from GovAlpha CU to CES CU. Updating process will remain unchanged for now.   COD2 - Off Chain Collateral Onboarding  roadmap-2022-02-16 (14) (1)4384×1436 279 KB   EPIC: Societé Generalé OFH Onboarding  2 new features have been implemented into the smart contracts for this collateral based on commercial, legal, and operational requirements. Refactor RwaConduit contracts to follow a more modular structure and best practices from other MakerDAO repositories. The team has successfully deployed an internal Goërli test environment, and onboarded a test version of OFH with an executive spell. Furthermore, the team has executed the borrow and repay DAI flows for the SocGen collateral. The content of the SocGen Technical Assessment document is finished. Formatting, wording, and final review is WIP. Created wireframes and defined functional requirements for RWA GUI for stakeholders of the SocGen deal.   EPIC: Off-chain Technical Advisory  Provided technical advisory support to RWF potential deals (names intentionally withheld). Provided technical advisory on institutional vaults UI and integrations   COD3 - On Chain Collateral Onboarding  roadmap-2022-02-164384×1036 209 KB   EPIC: On-board crvstETH as collateral  No work by CES done in this sprint. Status: Awaiting the audit for the vault manager by PE.   EPIC: On-chain Technical Advisory  Provided timely feedback to the PUNKS MIP6 application. Updated Collateral Status Index with new applicants   Collateral Maintenance  CMD1 - Collateral Operations  roadmap-2022-02-164384×840 173 KB   EPIC: Scope Collateral Maintenance  Collateral Offboarding Review document drafted and shared with stakeholders for assessment. Currently in RFC.   General Updates  CMO1 - CU Management & Operations  roadmap-2022-02-164384×1036 207 KB   EPIC: CES Budget Cycle  Status: Formal Submission - MIP40c3-SP57: Modify Core Unit Budget - Collateral Engineering Services (CES-001)   EPIC: CES Onboard, hiring, accounting  Vetted candidates for the Lead Smart Contract Engineering position Vetted candidates for the VA Office Manager position Completed CU payroll and expense payments Delivered January 2022 CES CU budget summary to @Aes
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

discourse_list.title: CES Sprint Update #3 (2022/Q1 - Feb 28th to Mar 11th 2022)

content.content: As defined in the Collateral Management Lifecycle (CML) post, the life cycle implies two big focus areas for CES: Collateral Onboarding and Collateral Maintenance. Within these areas we categorize our output into a set of deliverables(COD1-3, CMD1, CMO1). CES provides a bi-monthly update synced with the end of each sprint (2 weeks work cycle). Questions❔ Join our Discord and engage with us! JOIN NOW  1600×598 89.3 KB  Roadmap: collapse version - only milestones. Timelines in these updates only include technical scope from CES CU. Most projects include work from other CUs and those timelines are not displayed in these updates.  Collateral Onboarding  COD1 - COB Process   1600×306 43.4 KB    EPIC: Collateral Onboarding Process Revamp  To support the upcoming changes in the Collateral Onboarding Process Revamp, we published the following MIPs:  Published MIP6c3-SP2: Modify the collateral application. Published MIP4c2-SP18: MIP7 Amendments. Published MIP7c3-SP7: CES Domain Team Onboarding.     COD2 - Off Chain Collateral Onboarding   1600×526 66.5 KB    EPIC: Société Générale OFH Onboarding  Delivered instructions and guided SocGen devs on how to interact programmatically with their vault in Goërli testnet. DIIS Group UI was implemented and internally demoed. New findings about legal compliance in the “Repay DAI” money flow have been raised. A new onboarding architecture needs to be further discussed and agreed upon. This will delay the technical readiness by one month (end of April) as captured in the image above.   EPIC: Off-chain Technical Advisory  Touchpoints with 2 new potential deals have been booked.   COD3 - On Chain Collateral Onboarding   1600×380 50.8 KB    EPIC: On-chain Technical Advisory  Updated Collateral Status Index with poll status updates. Added links to all greenlight polls (active, greenlit or deferred) to ease the task of finding them.   EPIC: MIP6: Establish collateral benchmarks  Continued work on defining metrics for which a benchmark for recommended collateral candidates for onboarding and offboarding can be created. Started soliciting feedback from involved Core Units.   Collateral Maintenance  CMD1 - Collateral Operations   1600×306 42.7 KB    EPIC: Scope Collateral Maintenance  Agreed to move forward with a Signal Request based upon the collaterals in the Collateral Offboarding Review document.  TUSD offboarding poll completed with a Yes. Move to follow the MIP62 process.   General Updates  CMO1 - CU Management & Operations   1600×380 46 KB    EPIC: CES Budget Cycle  No update   EPIC: CES Operations    David Krett will be joining us as Senior Engineer/Architect! Most recently, David was, a Blockchain Solution Architect and Engineering Lead with EY, where he had primary responsibility for OpsChain Public Financial Management (an ethereum based blockchain solution that promotes transparency in budgeting and financial management by governments and large organizations) and acted as an SMR for various blockchain and digital asset tokenization assignments. Previously, David was a lead developer at Chainsafe Systems, developing on the Ethereum protocol layer, and has held various mentoring and teaching roles. He has extensive web development experience including acting as CTO and a CoFounder for a web2 based startup, development of Greenfield websites, api’s for a variety of applications and advising numerous startups encountering scaling issues. David brings significant business domain experience having previously worked for over 13+ years working in Asia and North America as an investment banker and corporate finance advisor, in that role he has been involved in the underwriting of loans and private placements for both institutional investors and bank lenders. At MakerDao, David is looking forward to contributing his technology expertise, product development knowledge and extensive business domain knowledge to develop onboarding and other processes to facilitate scaling of the MakerDao protocol. Continued vetting candidates for Collateral Program Manager position .   Previous Sprint Updates   CES Sprint Update #1 (2022/Q1 - Jan 31st to Feb 11th 2022)   CES Sprint Update #2 (2022/Q1 - Feb 14th to Feb 25th 2022)
